elements.title: John Neilson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Neilson (pictured), a Scottish immigrant to Lower Canada, became a major publisher and bookseller, and was reportedly "the largest consumer of paper" in the country?

elements.title: Serious Sam: The First Encounter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the production of Serious Sam: The First Encounter, all of its developers were conscripted into the Croatian military?

elements.title: Athanasios Rhousopoulos (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Athanasios Rhousopoulos, one of Athens's major archaeological criminals, made a speech complaining about the high rate of archaeological crime?

elements.title: an Arizona TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some viewers of an Arizona TV station saw hardcore pornography instead of the Super Bowl?

elements.title: Jim Jordan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that hundreds of people lived in Jim Jordan's orbit in "Jordanville"?

elements.title: some ancient Athenian coins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some ancient Athenian coins featured the faces of gorgons?

elements.title: Manaka Matsukubo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Manaka Matsukubo, the youngest player to start in the NWSL Challenge Cup, was named most valuable player of this year's final?

elements.title: people are robbing Lebanese banks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that people are robbing Lebanese banks to get their own money back?
